meanings.sent1: I had to reschedule my dentist appointment for next week.
meanings.sent2: She rescheduled the meeting for tomorrow afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The rescheduling of the soccer game caused confusion among the players.
meanings.sent4: After rescheduling my study sessions, I finally found a routine that worked for me.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to reschedule your doctor's appointment if you can't make it on time.

meanings.definition: The act of rearranging a previously planned event or appointment
meanings.sent1: The rescheduling of the concert disappointed many fans.
meanings.sent2: We had to deal with the rescheduling of the school play due to bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The rescheduling of the party turned out to be a blessing in disguise as more friends could attend.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a constant rescheduling of plans, never settling into a routine.
meanings.sent5: The rescheduling of the flight caused chaos at the airport.
